alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 6:38PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Alleghany and northwestern Surry Counties in northwestern North Carolina, south central Carroll and southeastern Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 715 PM EDT... At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Low Gap, or near Bottom, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Fancy Gap... Ennice... Cana... Mountain Park... and Bottom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
